Generation II.Gold: Its well-developed jaws are powerful and capable of crushing anything. Even its trainer must be careful.
Generation II.Silver: It is small but rough and tough. It won't hesitate to take a bite out of anything that moves.
Generation II.Crystal: This rough critter chomps at any moving object it sees. Turning your back on it is not recommended.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Its well-developed jaws are powerful and capable of crushing anything. Even its trainer must be careful. Generation II.Gold: First partner Pokémon from Professor Elm in New Bark Town
Generation II.Silver: First partner Pokémon from Professor Elm in New Bark Town
Generation II.Crystal: First partner Pokémon from Professor Elm in New Bark Town

Generation III.Emerald: Received from Professor Birch at Littleroot Town after completing the Hoenn Pokédex
Generation III.XD: Reward for defeating 100 Trainers in Mt. Battle

Generation IV.HeartGold: First partner Pokémon from Professor Elm in New Bark Town
Generation IV.SoulSilver: First partner Pokémon from Professor Elm in New Bark Town

Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Received from Professor Birch on Route 101 after first entering the Hall of Fame
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Received from Professor Birch on Route 101 after first entering the Hall of Fame

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Grand Underground - Fountainspring Cave , Riverbank Cave , Still-Water Cavern (after obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Grand Underground - Fountainspring Cave , Riverbank Cave , Still-Water Cavern (after obtaining the National Pokédex )

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Savanna Biome (after boosting biodiversity in the Savanna Biome)
